intro: Psychotria borjensis, commonly known as the Borjénsian Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in understory layers of rainforests. Psychotria borjensis is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
